column5: 1. Do you have a company wide cyber security policy?
column6: 2. Do you have any cyber security awareness posters around the office?
column7: 3. Do you have an internal person and/or external company who is responsible for your organisations cyber security?
column8: 4. How often is cyber security discussed at a management / board level?
column9: 5. Do you currently have cyber insurance?
column10: 6. Has your organisation ever experienced a cyber security incident?
column11: 7. Do you have a formal Information Security (IS) document which lists confidential information to your organisation and how this information should be handled by staff?
column12: 8. Do you have a simple process to audit 3rd parties for their cyber security resilience before sharing confidential information?
column13: 9. Have you identified mission critical information and services that would cause significant disruption to your business, if interrupted or lost?
column14: 10. Do you have an inventory of all devices / phones / computers and details of what confidential information each holds?
column15: 11. Do you have encryption enabled on all devices, and a policy to ensure that all new devices have encryption enabled by default.
column16: 12. Do you have a formal process when disposing of old computers or mobile phones?
column17: 13. Do you centralise management and configuration of all computers?
column18: 15. Do you have network segmentation implemented to separate critical areas from non-critical areas? (such as BYOD Wi-Fi networks)
column19: 16. Do you monitor network traffic for abnormal activity?
column20: 17. Do you store access and activity logs for network devices?
column21: 18. Have you performed a penetration test in the past 18 months?
column22: 19. Do you have any intrusion detection / prevention systems in place?
column23: 20. Do you have restrictions to limit what type of applications an employee can run on their company computers?
column24: 21. Do you have an internal or external provider regularly applying software patches / system updates?
column25: 22. Have you disabled default macro functions in Microsoft Office applications? (eg: Excel / Word / Powerpoint)
column26: 23. Have you investigated application specific settings to harden default security settings? (eg. web browsers and operating systems)
column27: 24. If you use cloud storage for any documents (eg: Dropbox, Google Drive), do you have two-factor authentication enabled?
column28: 25. If you use a cloud based CRM, do you have two-factor enabled?
column29: 26. Do you use a password manager?
column30: 27. Do you enforce the use of strong and unique passwords?
column31: 28. Do you have a policy or process around how removable media (eg: USB drives) should be used and what information can be copied onto these drives?
column32: 29. Has autoplay for removable media been diabled on work machines?
column33: 30. Do you enforce two-factor for webmail access?
column34: 31. Do you have SPAM and anti-virus filtering enabled for inbound email?
column35: 32. Do you have an acceptable email use policy?
column36: 33. Do you have outgoing policies in place to ensure large volumes of data (eg. excel, zip files) can not be sent?
column37: 34. Do you have website filters in place to restrict access to websites that may be harmful to your organisation? (eg: torrents / gambling)
column38: 35. Do you have an acceptable internet use policy?
column39: 36. Do you have an active anti-virus service?
column40: 37. Is the anti-virus centrally managed and are updates applied regularly?
column41: 38. Do you have an offline copy of critical domain name details? (eg: renewal dates / domain keys)
column42: 39. Do you have an offline copy of critical website hosting details? (eg: server location / FTP access details)
column43: 40. Do you complete regular malware scans of your website?
column44: 41. Is user data collected from your website stored securely?
column45: 42. Are you confident that staff are cyber aware and understand cyber risks to the organisation?
column46: 43. Would staff know how to identify a spear phishing email?
column47: 44. Have staff ever completed cyber security training?
column48: 45. Do you have a VPN setup for staff to connect to the office remotely?
column49: 46. Do you have guidelines for staff to use their personal computers to access your organisations systems and data?
column50: 47. Do you have a recovery plan of who is responsible for what and who has access to recovery data?
column51: 48. Do you perform regular backups of computers and servers?
column52: 49. Do you test the integrity of backups on a regular basis?
column53: 50. Are you aware of what notification is required to send to customers should you experience a breach?
column54: 51. Do you maintain computer / server logs to investigate a breach should one occur?
column55: 52. Do you have a basic plan of action (incident response plan) which outlines roles and responsibilities should you experience a cyber incident?
column56: 53. Have you specifically investigated your legal risk relating to cyber security?
column57: 54. Have you specifically investigated your regulatory obligations with relation to cyber security?
